title: Administrator - Laboratory Services
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**

Since 1875, South Brooklyn Health has established its reputation for clinical excellence and culturally competent care. It has designations as a Certified Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) Center, an Advanced Primary Stroke Center, an accredited Baby-Friendly Hospital, a U.S. News & World Report high performing hospital. The hospital's staff is as diverse as the patients they serve. Interpreter services can be provided at any time of the day or night in over 130 languages.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

**Job Description**

**Work Schedule: Monday - Friday, 9:00AM - 5:00PM (Alternate Work Schedule May Be Required)**

**Purpose:**

The Operations Director, under the direction of senior hospital administration, serves as an integral part of a multidisciplinary team, administering and overseeing the daily operations of the Laboratory Department and ensures the delivery of patient-centered, cost effective quality care, and a culture of safety across the continuum of care. Ensures optimal utilization of resources and compliance with clinical laboratory standards, resulting in improved outcomes and patient experience.

**Specific Duties and Responsibilities:**

The Operation Director, Laboratory is responsible for:

Leads the day-to-day operations of the laboratory through effective planning, organizing, prioritizing and evaluating of operational activities. Ensures alignment with the System’s mission, values, and business goals and performs daily rounds in the laboratory to provide supervision and assess the overall effectiveness of operations.

Partners with senior leadership, clinical staff, and other key stakeholders, to advance the Laboratory’s programs and initiatives, and monitors the impact and effectiveness of the laboratory programs.

Participates in collaboration with the Clinical Laboratory Director and/or Blood Bank Laboratory Director, sets the department’s objectives, operational and financial performance goals, monitors staff and resource utilization, overtime and laboratory workload on an ongoing basis and makes staffing adjustments to achieve departmental goals and objectives.

Ensures the ongoing review of existing laboratory policies and standard operating procedures to identify gaps or discrepancies and implement revisions, as necessary, to support quality control and risk management.

Serves as a principal advisor and key resource to senior leadership, clinical staff, and other appropriate parties on all matters pertaining to laboratory services, relevant regulatory requirements, and other factors relating to clinical excellence.

Monitors and reviews departmental safety data and presents key findings to the Environmental Health and Safety Officer and other appropriate parties and collaborates with staff to create strategies and recommendations for interventions and appropriate control measures.

Oversees the timely and comprehensive investigations of accidents and appropriate reports to local, state and federal public health and regulatory agencies. Makes recommendations for action plans for the prevention of accidents and to determine containment and control measures to foster a culture of safety for patients, staff and visitors.

Prepares and/or actively participates in the development of the laboratory fiscal year budget and allocation of funds and ensures operations run within budgetary guidelines.

Oversees processes governing the operation and maintenance of all laboratory equipment, instruments and supplies. Ensures equipment needs are met, participates in the selection of new equipment, and follows safety and quality management standards, including allotment of sufficient space for performance of laboratory tasks by staff.

Ensures selection of qualified laboratory personnel and ongoing maintenance of documentation regarding staff licensure and credentials and keeps complete and accurate documentation.

Establishes an environment conducive to continuing education for staff and assists in the development of in-services, training programs and activities, and coordinates orientation, training, and guidance to staff to support the continuity of care.

Oversees performance assessment and management, participates in selection and disciplinary activities and works with Labor Relations to enforce H+H policies. Ensures ethical standards of performance conduct in the performance of all duties by laboratory staff.

Maintains an effective working relationship with all regulatory and accrediting agencies and ensures appropriate coordination of audits and inspections, including the timely submission of corrective action plans and implementation of corrective actions, when required.

Participates in internal/external quality assurance/performance improvement (QA/PI) activities, programs, training, and relevant health care events, as required. Oversees and drives ongoing quality system assessment and improvement activities, identifies problems and recommends standard, cost-effective measures and improvements.

Promotes effective interdepartmental relationships through consultation with other departments as needed to collaborate in patient care and performance improvement activities and represents the laboratory in hospital wide committees to provide a comprehensive approach to clinical laboratory service delivery.

Ensures ongoing compliance and maintenance of the NYC Health + Hospitals policies and procedures with national standards and other applicable external regulatory requirements, guidelines and accreditation authorities as well as safety and quality management standards

Performs other related duties, as directed.

Perform all duties in alignment with the mission, vision, values, and behavioral expectations of NYC Health + Hospitals

**Minimum Qualifications**

1. Holds and maintains a Clinical Laboratory Technologist License issued by the New York State Education Department (NYSED) and meets one of the qualification requirements of a laboratory supervisor as outlined in Title 10, Section 58-1.4 of the New York Public Health Law; and

2. Master’s degree from an accredited college or university in Biology, Medical Technology, Clinical Laboratory Sciences or a related field; and five (5) years of experience overseeing laboratory operations, creating and establishing laboratory programs and reviewing and interpreting safety data, in a hospital or health care  
setting, three (3) years of which must have been in a responsible administrative, managerial or supervisory capacity; or

3. Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in one of the fields described in “2” above; and, seven (7) years of laboratory experience as described in “2” above, five (5) years of which must have been in a responsible administrative, managerial or supervisory capacity; or

4. A satisfactory equivalent of education, training, and experience. However, all candidates must be licensed and currently registered by the NYSED to practice as a Clinical Laboratory Technologist and meet one of the qualification requirements of a laboratory supervisor, as described in “1” above.

**How To Apply**

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $150,000.00 - $160,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Experience:

* Laboratory management: 3 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* Clinical Laboratory Technologist License (Required)

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Controls Service Technician
description:
**If you thrive in a team-oriented workplace that challenges your skills, to drive your career development, embraces diversity and rewards innovation, with competitive pay and great employee programs, join the Ainsworth (a GDI company) team today!**

**Position Summary:**

Responsible for the start-up & commissioning, trouble-shooting and repair of Automatic Temperature Control systems, utilizing knowledge of electronics, direct digital control, airflow, hydronics, refrigeration and air conditioning theory, and control techniques.

**Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for day to service assignments to various customers site. At times performing upgrades and service projects requiring end to end testing, program loading, start-up, commissioning, and assigned projects. Working independently and the ability to perform and schedule small service projects a plus.
* Uses a variety of hand tools, interpreting control drawings, plans and specifications, to mount, assemble, test, and program and service Building Management Systems.
* Analyzes, diagnoses, and repairs direct digital control systems on project sites.
* Low voltage electrical experience
* Performs preventive maintenance, site surveys, replacement, and modifications as needed or requested by customers.
* Prepares for on-site installation and repairs by examining building layout, anticipating difficulties, gathering materials and coordinating on-site work, as necessary.
* Provides training and follow-up training on customer site.
* Provides sales leads to appropriate personnel.
* Documents work by completing service work orders on each job, including daily timesheet, progress work reports, and maintaining files.
* Records parts, material, labor, and other cost data per assignment and returns unused parts.
* Turns in all required paperwork and reports in a timely manner.
* May represent company by serving as a direct customer contact.
* Identifies parts to order for repairs and timeliness of need.
* Keeps current on Delta products concerning installation, operation, maintenance, service and repair of DDC systems.
* Provides technical support to customers on assigned projects.
* Maintains vehicles by keeping records of service manuals, scheduling, completed repairs and maintenance service.
* Maintains hand tools (supplied by employee) and other special high end tools and equipment by inspecting for signs of wear and tear.
* Regular travel to and from assigned projects.
* Flexibility to work overtime/weekends, as required.

**Qualifications:**

* Ability to read, understand, and/or write short and simple correspondence and memos.
* Ability to effectively communicate in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.
* Ability to comprehend technical and mathematical instructions using numbers, fractions, decimals, ratio, and percent. Proficient in using laptop PCs and computer systems.
* Knowledge and experience in HVAC and Control systems is essential.
* Read and understand HVAC Drawings, control drawings and electrical drawings.
* Valid Driver’s License
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, sit, walk, climb a ladder, lift and/or move materials up to 50 lbs.

\\*This position requires working outdoors, in mechanical/equipment rooms and possible extreme weather conditions. Employee is exposed to moving mechanical parts and heavy equipment; to wet and/or humid conditions; to high, precarious places; to fumes or airborne particles; to outside weather conditions; to risk of electrical shock and vibration; to toxic or caustic chemicals; to extreme cold and extreme heat. The noise level in the work environment is usually loud.

**Why work at Ainsworth?**

Ainsworth is growing at an unprecedented rate and to help attract and retain top talent, we provide benefits on your first day with us. We offer a wide variety of benefits including the following:

***Benefits:*** Comprehensive health, dental and medical benefits, including wellness supports, 401K matching and generous vacation

***Rewards:*** Service milestones and peer recognition plus Employee Discounts and Incentives

***Flexibility:*** Hybrid working models, where applicable

***Diversity:*** An inclusive organization that embraces diversity and belonging; work in a great team atmosphere with future potential for promotion within company

While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

*Ainsworth is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. Qualified designated group members are encouraged to apply as any reasonable accommodation of qualifications will be considered as per our Accommodation Policy, available upon request.*

Ainsworth is an integrated multi-trade company, offering end-to-end services and solutions for all asset maintenance and refurbishment requirements of our customers. We are continually striving to create better and more advanced products as well as provide the highest quality service. We are rapidly growing and need talented professionals to help drive our vision at becoming the best multi-trade company in the country! **Join us…. Make a difference**.

**#INDUS**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $44.00 - $52.00 per hour

Application Question(s):

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

title: Office Coordinator
description:
**Company Overview**



JRM is one of the top General Contracting and Construction Management Firms with over a decade of trusted experience. Headquartered in New York City with offices in New Jersey, California, and Florida, JRM delivers the highest quality services to clients that include City, State & Federal Agencies, Fortune 500 corporations, respected property owners & developers, major law firms, media & tech firms, leading luxury retailers, renowned hospitality groups, life sciences & healthcare organizations, and financial services firms. JRM knows that dedicated, accomplished employees are the heart of any successful enterprise. We are focused on maintaining a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace and are always looking to add passionate personnel to our teams across the US.

**Job Summary**



Office Coordinator will be responsible for performing clerical, administrative, and facilities duties in the office. Additionally, the incumbent will take part in various ad hoc tasks and projects included below.


**Responsibilities and Duties**


* Book appointments, greet customers, schedule conference rooms, and maintain an organized office environment
* Maintain office supplies by checking stock to determine inventory levels
* Assist with clerical duties such as photocopying, faxing, and filing
* Assist receptionist with answering phone calls, greeting guests, and directing guests and employees to conference rooms
* Lead office tours and meet & greets for new hires; prepare welcome packages and show them evacuation routes and meet up locations
* Ordering and keeping track of inventory for supplies, food, beverages, etc. for kitchens, conference rooms and pantries
* Ensure office conference rooms and common spaces are clean and organized prior to and following meetings
* Maintain and clean kitchen equipment including coffee machine.
* Perform occasional cleaning duties as needed (i.e. trash removal, cleaning and restocking break rooms, etc.)
* Maintain and improve office tidiness and organization to create an efficient workplace
* Manage the cleaning crew to ensure office cleanliness
* Organize and distribute all company swag through our request system
* Assist with various projects for multiple departments and individuals


**Qualifications and skills**


* Bachelor's Degree Preferred
* Flexible professional with a 2+ years of corporate experience (construction industry preferred)
* Superior oral and written communication skills
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills


**Computer Systems**


* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook)


**Salary Information**


* To the extent this position is performed in New York City, the annual salary offered for this role is $55,000.


*The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training, and skill level.*

title: Assistant Manager
description:
**SNIPES Assistant Manager**


**Full Time Hourly**



We live sneakers, streetwear, and neighborhood culture! All Day! Every Day!



With more than 750 stores in Europe and the USA, SNIPES is one of the leading sneaker and streetwear retailers worldwide. Since opening its first store in Essen, Germany in 1998, SNIPES has been an integral part of street culture and is constantly growing thanks to its proximity to the community and regular openings worldwide.



At SNIPES, everything revolves around youth culture. In stores and online at snipes.com and snipesusa.com, our community finds a wide range of internationally renowned sneakers and apparel brands for the latest fits from head to toe. We dive deep into subcultures, sponsor some of the biggest hip-hop festivals, events, and sports teams throughout the world to stay close to our community and keep our deep roots in the global street culture community. Therefore, we work closely with key figures from the scene like DJ Khaled, our Chief Creative Officer. But whether it’s sponsorships or developing grassroots projects – we prioritize giving back to the community in everything we do.



SNIPES has always kept an ear to the streets to create a meaningful impact in the communities we serve. Through our community program “SNIPES serves” and its localized approach we support the needs of our communities, empower, and celebrate our dynamic culture.


**Overview:** As an Assistant Manager, you will fully manage the store’s staff and operations in the absence of the Store Manager.


**Responsibilities**


* Assist the Store Manager in ensuring store meets Company standards for cleanliness, both on the sales floor and in the stockroom
* Effectively set up sales/promotions with proper signing in a timely manner
* Properly process register functions and ensure they are properly followed in the store
* Ability to demonstrate timely execution and compliance of floor set guides and promotions
* Assist Store Manager in directing and maintaining merchandise presentation according to Visual Merchandising standards and current floor set
* Recognize, understand, and communicate customer merchandise needs and recognize when the store’s merchandise assortment meets, and fails to meet, these needs
* Work with Store Manager to ensure markdowns and transfers are completed correctly and in a timely manner
* Demonstrate leadership in driving sales and profitability by achieving or exceeding all established store and individual goals
* Assist the Store Manager with communicating the stores operational goals and directives to maximize store teams contributions towards meeting the sales plan
* Assist the Store Manager in monitoring and evaluating individual performance in the following areas: sales volume, hourly production, units per transaction, charge accounts an loss prevention
* Accurately perform and assist Store Manager in training associates in all appropriate register and/or Aptos functions
* Ensure the securing of Company funds as outlines in Company policy


**Key Partners**


* Store Management
* Human Resources
* District Manager
* Asset Protection


**Qualifications**


* Must be at least 18 years of age
* At least 2+ years’ experience in retail leadership as an Assistant Manager or Department a plus
* High School Diploma or equivalent; College degree a plus but not required
* Able to respond to store alarm problems as needed
* Excellent communication and organizational skills
* Strong drive to achieve results
* Takes initiative and has problem solving skills
* Candidate will be required to stand for long periods of time throughout their shift.
* Lifting between 15-30 pounds.


**Skills & Cultural Success Factors**


* Enthusiasm for the brand
* Strong customer service skills
* Excellent communication skills
* Strong problem solving skills
* Team player with the ability to lead a team
* Disciplined and self-motivated
* Goal oriented
* Adaptable and flexible
* Fast learner

* Generous Employee Discount
* Paid Holidays
* PTO (Paid Time Off)
* Bonus Plan
* Affordable Health Insurance
* Retirement Contributions

In addition, we reserve the right to add, delete, change duties, formally or informally, verbally or in writing, at any time for any position. Job descriptions do not alter the at-will policy of the Company, meaning that the employee or employer can terminate employment at any time, for any reason, with or without cause.*


*Snipes USA and all its subsidiary Companies are equal opportunity employers. We will not discriminate or make hiring decisions based on race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, political affiliation, sexual orientation, or any other criteria that would violate any Federal or State laws.*

#### **Behaviors**


Preferred* Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity
* Enthusiastic: Shows intense and eager enjoyment and interest
* Team Player: Works well as a member of a group
* Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well

#### **Motivations**

title: Automation Test Lead
description:
Infosys is seeking an **Technical Test Lead**.
  

  

As a Technical Test Lead, you will act as a validation and quality assurance expert and review the functionality of existing systems. You will conduct requirement analysis, define test strategy & design and lead execution to guarantee superior outcomes. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with some of the best talent in the industry to create innovative high quality and defect-free solutions to meet our clients’ business needs. You will be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued.  

  

**Required Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.
* 4 years of Information Technology experience
* U.S. citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time.
* Candidate must be located within commuting distance of **Jersey City, NJ** or be willing to relocate. This position may require travel in the US and Canada
* At least 4 years of software testing experience
* At least 4 years of core java or Selenium Test NG automation experience
* API automation using Rest Assured
* Proficient in writing SQL queries
* At least 4 years hands on experience in test automation tools Selenium, Java, Cucumber & SQL
* Experience with tools such as Cucumber, Cypress, TestNG, IntelliJ, GitHub and Eclipse
* Knowledge and experience working in Banking domain.
* Must be Proficient in Agile methodology and experience with Jira, designing Testcases, Test Execution
* Experience in REST APIs & Postman
* Exposure to UAT testing is an added advantage.
* Agile experience
* Understanding of CI/CD
* Understanding of test management process and SDLC/STLC
* Good soft skills

  

**Preferred Qualifications*** Experience working in a DevOps environment, Gitlab, SCD and hands on experience using CI/CD systems preferred to enable test data pipeline.
* Experience in hands-on Python programming language experience used to build test automation.
* Domain experience in investment banking products and corporate action

  

The job entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email or face to face. Travel may be required as per the job requirements.  



  

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Infosys is seeking a Business Analyst.**  

This position’s primary responsibility will be to help clients with strategy definition, value realization, implementation, and operations. The role holder will be a key player in the team that helps discover and define the problem statement, Code, Test and implement. You will create detailed design, architecture and process artifacts, Code, test and implement the deployment plan. You will also support knowledge transfer with the objective of providing value-adding consulting solutions. Our team is seeking a passionate Techno-functional profiles to support the definition and delivery of solutions, in the Capital markets domain. We are looking for highly motivated individuals who are seeking to meaningfully empower our business partners with core data management technology solutions. You will serve as a change advocate, driving a user-centric view with powerful experiences that delight our customers. You will also strengthen our channels of communication and uphold our principles of transparency and partnership while engaging with product peers, design experts, program leaders and engineering partners to drive successful product execution.
  

  

Candidate must be located within commuting distance of **Jersey City, NJ or Pennington, NJ or Bridgewater, NJ** and this position will require you to work out of client locations.  

  

U.S. citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time.  

  

**Required Qualifications*** Bachelors degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.
* At least 2 years of experience with Information Technology.
* Experience as a Business Analyst.

**Preferred Qualifications*** At least 2 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Functional Analyst.
* Ability to deliver results in a techno-functional role, in an Agile environment.
* Strong experience in SQL programming.
* Should have very strong command of data structures and algorithms, plus how the Java collections framework uses them.
* Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical skills with the ability to translate business data analysis into actionable tasks.
* Ability to author thorough, detailed, high-quality documentation, including customer journey maps, user stories, use cases and test scripts.
* Must have in-depth hands-on knowledge of Core Java.
* Design, implement and maintain Java-based applications that can be high-volume and low-latency.
* Analyze user requirements to define business objectives.
* Strong in object-oriented design principles and functional programming.
* In-depth knowledge of the Java concurrency framework is a must.
* A very strong command of data structures and algorithms, plus how the Java collections framework uses them.
* Facilitate the gathering and elicitation of business requirements from key stakeholders and business partners focused around solving organizational challenges.
* Prioritize user stories and work expected within the Sprints for squad based on urgency, pervasiveness (the greater good) and organizational goals.
* Excellent problem-solving abilities.
* Experience in Capital Markets Domain.
* Ability to identify risks and issues and propose improvements.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  

*The job entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email or face to face. Travel may be required as per the job requirements.*

title: Executive of Retail Operations
description:
**Ready to Ignite Change with The Inspiration Co.? This is Your Chance!**

At The Inspiration Co., we harness the transformative power of inspiration to elevate lives and create a better world. Our environment is one where people are truly valued, and our mission is clear: live an inspired life and share stories of triumph and testimony. Every day, our nationwide teams bring our purpose to life: to inspire change, encourage faith, and ignite the passion within each of us to take control of our daily experiences and create masterpieces of our lives. United by a common goal, we focus on the good and help others do the same.**Your Dream Opportunity: Executive of Retail Operations**

We’re searching for a dynamic leader with the vision and drive to oversee their own store and make a meaningful impact. If you’re ready to join a company that’s not just about selling products but about making a positive difference in the world, this is the opportunity you’ve been waiting for.

**Your Role:**

As an Executive of Retail Operations, you'll be at the helm of store operations, ensuring top-notch customer service and driving sales. Your leadership will create a vibrant work environment that fosters growth and development. You’ll build meaningful relationships with customers, connecting them with our collections of Faith, Hope, and Love through their personal stories.

Here’s what the role entails:

* **Lead with Purpose:** Manage daily store operations with passion, inspire your team, and deliver exceptional customer experiences that reflect The Inspiration Co.’s mission.
* **Drive Success:** Implement strategies that boost sales and profitability, ensuring goals are not just met but exceeded.
* **Develop Your Team:** Mentor and empower your team, conducting regular evaluations and providing ongoing training to help them hit their goals.
* **Manage Inventory:** Oversee inventory management, ensuring benchmarks are exceeded, forecasts are accurate, and the store is well-prepared for each season.
* **Engage with the Community:** Act as the face of The Inspiration Co. in your local area, building connections and spreading positivity.

**What’s in It for You?**

* **Competitive Pay + Commission:** Enjoy a solid base pay rate with the opportunity to enhance your earnings through commissions tied to store performance.
* **Health Benefits:** We’ve worked for years to make this dream a reality and are thrilled to offer comprehensive health benefits after a few months with us.
* **Paid Time Off:** Take advantage of paid time off, knowing that during peak periods, you'll be fully engaged—our execs recharge after the rush.
* **Ongoing Training:** Access executive-level training in business, marketing, and leadership to keep you at the top of your game.
* **Executive Retreats:** Participate in exclusive retreats to connect with other leaders, strategize, and grow with The Inspiration Co. family.

**Ready to Join Our Team? Here’s How to Apply!**

Please check out our Social Media Handles and website to get a better feel for our brand and what we are all about. We are looking to add not just top talent from around the country to our team, but more importantly people who really get what we're all about and have a heart for creating a better, more positive world one bracelet at a time.

Website: InspirationCo.Com  
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/inspiremebracelets/  
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theinspiration\\_co/?hl=en

If this is you, please apply for the Executive of Retail Operations position at The Inspiration Co., please complete the application form using the link below:

APPLY HERE  
https://forms.gle/v6rNWdXkcV4kDquD7

In addition to the form, we’d love to get to know you better. Please send an email to Derek@inspiremebracelets.com with the subject line "Executive of Retail Operations Application - [Your Name]" and include your answers to the following questions:

* **Full Name and Best Contact Number**
* **Performance Metrics:** What key performance indicators (KPIs) did you focus on in your previous role, and how did you use them to drive success?
* **Leadership Philosophy:** What is your personal leadership philosophy, and how does it align with The Inspiration Co.’s mission and values?
* **Team Development:** How do you approach developing and mentoring team members? Can you provide an example where your leadership made a significant impact on someone’s professional growth?
* **Handling Challenges:** Describe a significant challenge you faced in a leadership role. How did you address it, and what was the outcome?
* **Strategic Initiatives:** If given the opportunity to introduce a new initiative to enhance store performance, what would it be and why?
* **Customer Engagement:** How do you build meaningful relationships with customers and connect them with the values and products of The Inspiration Co.?
* **Cultural Fit:** Which aspects of The Inspiration Co.’s mission and values resonate most with you, and how do you integrate these into your daily work and leadership style?
* **Problem Solving:** Tell us about a complex problem you encountered in your previous role. How did you approach solving it, and what was the result?
* **Motivation and Drive:** What motivates you to seek this leadership role with The Inspiration Co., and how does this position align with your long-term career goals?
* **Vision for the Role:** Where do you see yourself in the next 3-5 years, and how does this role at The Inspiration Co. fit into your overall career plan?
* **Location:** Which store location are you applying for?

We are excited to learn more about you and how you can contribute to our mission of spreading inspiration and making a positive impact!

title: Social Worker - Level III (ACT II)
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**

In its century of service, Coney Island Hospital has established its reputation for clinical excellence and culturally competent care. The hospital has been recognized for its clinical innovations in Primary Care, Adolescent Medicine, Nuclear Medicine and Emergency Services. The hospital's staff is as diverse as the patients they serve. Interpreter services can be provided at any time of the day or night in over 130 languages.

**Job Description**

**Purpose**:

Under professional supervision and as a member of an interdisciplinary team, provides clinical social work services individual, group, and family -- to adult and geriatric psychiatric patients registered in the Assertive Community Treatment Team.

**Specific Duties and Responsibilities:**

The Social Worker III is charged with and responsible for:

Provides clinical supervision, prepares evaluations and competencies for assigned social service staff, and/or graduate students.

Orients and trains new employees.

May have in charge duties, in the absence of Program Director, as requested.

Prepares and presents education material for social work and other professionals.

May lead or work on various committees/task groups for the department.

As primary therapist and case manager, is responsible for psychosocial assessment, treatment planning, discharge planning and direct care to patients on caseload.

Provides individual and family psychotherapy, intakes psycho-education, substance abuse counseling, psychiatric rehabilitation and crisis intervention services.

Coordinates psychiatric and medical treatment, as required. Provides concrete social services assessment and interventions.

Makes home visits and escorts patients to various appointments, as needed.

Provides on call, beeper coverage on a rotation basis.

Participates in conferences, training programs, performance assessment and improvement activities, departmental, discipline and team meetings. Prepares and presents in-service education.

Prepares and maintains appropriate records, summaries and reports following the guidelines of assigned unit.

**Minimum Qualifications**

For Assignment to Level III  
1. Valid license as an LCSW issued by the NYSED.

**Please be advised that proof of Covid-19 vaccination is required prior to hire.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

License/Certification:

* Licensed Clinical Social Worker (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: MBA Playbook Sales & Marketing Focused Founder in Training Program
description:
**Company Mission**

At Playbook, we believe that everyone deserves access to incredible sports & academic programs. Through our best-in-class technology and integrated platform services, we are revolutionizing the way that sports, education, and activity entrepreneurs launch and manage programs for students and communities across the world. We have an amazing list of customers and partners including most professional sports teams, Fortune 500 companies, and hundreds of leading sports and activity organizations across the country. We also have established partnerships with star athletes including and influencers who embody our values and support our mission.

**MBA Playbook Founder in Training Sales & Marketing Track** 

Over the past 3 years we've had success with a very selective rotational program for elite graduates with a passion for sports and entrepreneurship. We're expanding the program this year to hire 2 graduates to focus on our innovative sales and marketing tactics being used to drive the business.

We are looking for people who

* MBA, Masters in Sales, or Equivalent
* Have a desire to start a company in the future
* Have a persistent growth hacker mentality
* Have a deep passion for using AI to create innovative solutions to solve real world problems.
* Have an incredible ability to solve problems
* Have the ability to shape projects and manage teams working on multiple projects at once
* Have extreme curiosity
* Have a Bias for Action and a get things done mentality

Over 18 months you'll work directly under our CEO, CTO, Director of AI, and Director of Marketing. You'll be instrumental in shaping a new paradigm in how local sports, recreation, and activities can be managed and serviced. At the end of 18 months, you'll be promoted to a key role in the company that aligns with your strengths, interests, and career development interests. The program is designed for individuals that want to become a AI founder in the future. You'll have extensive exposure to all aspects of Playbooks growth and development during an exciting and formative period. You'll be given significant responsibility on an accelerated basis and you'll be working with talented, like minded individuals within an amazing, sports obsessed culture.

**Some of the things you might work on**

**SEO & Content Strategy Leveraging AI**

We're building unique content strategies leveraging our platform on many dimensions including our open source free products as well as partnerships with professional athletes and sports teams

**Product Generated Leads & Cross Marketing**

Develop strategies to leverage data across our platform to generate upsells and new business.

**Strategic Sales Enablement**

Analyze data across our sales funnel and find ways to increase close rate and average order value.

**Help Optimizing:**

* Paid ads
* Email and other direct marketing
* Landing pages
* Referral strategies
* IOS/Android store optimization
* Proprietary enterprise strategies

**Why You Should Be Interested:**

**Learning**- As a part of your role you will be on multiple meetings per week with the CEO. Within our transparent culture, you will gain exposure to all parts of the business. You will also be working closely with small business owners and learn a tremendous amount from these relationships. **If your ultimate goal is to start a business one day**, our role is designed for you to reach that goal at an accelerated rate.

**Accelerated Growth**- We have a flat, meritocratic culture. Your insights and ideas will have the potential to shape the company on day one. There is no bureaucracy, politics, or blockers to your growth here. We have a track record of rapidly promoting exceptionally talented individuals.

**Financial Upside** - We are generous with equity options and we are taking off like a rocket ship towards our mission of building Shopify for sports and community organizations.

**Sports**- If you love sports, you'll love our culture. We have an incredible group of people that love sports here and sports are an instrumental part of our culture. Sportscasters and games are on in the office all day. We have monthly outings to VIP experiences at NBA, NFL, NHL, and MLS games.

* Holidays

title: Head of Data and AI, Group Benefits
description:
For more than 60 years, Guardian’s Group Benefits business has been a leader in meeting the needs of employers of all sizes, by offering a wide portfolio of products and services. As our largest business area, we serve more than 110,000 employers and reach more than 26.5 million consumers. Along with having the second largest dental network in the US.
Guardian Life is seeking a transformational leader to join our team as the Head of Data and AI, Group Benefits. Working closely with our Chief Data and AI Officer, you will shape our Data and AI strategy for our Group Benefits Business to drive business value and customer satisfaction.
The D&AI team is driving insights, AI and data activation across Guardian to enable successful delivery of Guardian’s strategy. The team’s mission is to be a trusted partner that continuously enables scalable and mutually valuable customer solutions. The EDAO’s activities to achieve this mission include data lifecycle management, data solution design and execution, advanced analytics that drives insight development, and using our data and AI products to enable valuable business decisions and actions. We are team of data analysts, data product owners, data engineers, data scientists and most importantly, data business leaders. Our solutions and actions are critical to Group Business’ and Guardian’s revenue growth, risk management and customer experience.
As Group Benefits Business Head of Data and AI you will be driving the data, analytics and AI strategy and execution for the Group business, which includes defining and applying data, machine learning and artificial intelligence and solutions to business unit capabilities and products. Successful leaders in the role have expertise in insurance and financial services with a passion for designing and implementing data and AI capabilities and solutions that enable breakout growth, competitive advantage, and customer satisfaction.
You Are:* Exceptionally skilled in leading the development and implementation of data and AI solutions to solve complex business challenges.
* Fueled by collaboration, with a proven ability to transform conceptual thinking into actionable insights.
* An influential leader who enjoys working with multi-disciplinary teams to drive data-driven decision making.
* Driven by a passion for creating world-class data and AI capabilities that offer competitive advantages.


You Will:* Design and implement the Group Benefits Data and AI strategy and roadmap, identifying business opportunities across the value chain.
* Partner with the Group Business Leadership Team (GBLT) to contribute to, influence and implement department goals and priorities
* Lead an impactful Data and AI team, fostering strong, collaborative relationships across the organization.
* Apply strategic consulting and project management skills to drive the successful execution of data and AI projects.
* Evangelize data-informed decision-making and establish continuous improvement practices.
* Oversee compliance with regulatory and privacy requirements during the design and implementation of solutions.
* Sponsor data and analytic R&D/innovation and proof of concept initiatives to support long-term growth objectives.


You Have:* 15+ years of relevant industry experience with a proven track record of P&L contribution and value realization.
* Proven success delivering large-scale Data and AI projects on time and within budget, managing teams of 50+ employees both onshore and offshore.
* Proven experience carrying out supervisory responsibilities as leader of managers for at least 30 or more people.
* Exceptional communication skills and the ability to work effectively with senior executives.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with superb attention to detail.
* A degree or equivalent experience in a quantitative field and demonstrated leadership ability.


Location & Travel:* New York City, Boston MA, or Bethlehem PA
* Flex 3+ (Hybrid)


Salary Range:
$250,000 - $300,000
The salary range reflected above is a good faith estimate of base pay for the primary location of the position. The salary for this position ultimately will be determined based on the education, experience, knowledge, and abilities of the successful candidate. In addition to salary, this role may also be eligible for annual, sales, or other incentive compensation.
Our Promise
At Guardian, you’ll have the support and flexibility to achieve your professional and personal goals. Through skill-building, leadership development and philanthropic opportunities, we provide opportunities to build communities and grow your career, surrounded by diverse colleagues with high ethical standards.  

Inspire Well-Being
As part of Guardian’s Purpose – to inspire well-being – we are committed to offering contemporary, supportive, flexible, and inclusive benefits and resources to our colleagues.
Health Care* Choice of [high deductible/copay] medical plans\\* with prescription drugs, including coverage for fertility and transgender inclusive benefits
* Dental plan
* Vision plan
* Health care accounts – flexible spending, health reimbursement, and health savings accounts
* Critical illness insurance


Life and Disability Insurance* Company-paid Life and Disability insurance plus voluntary supplemental coverage
* Accident insurance


Retirement and Financial* 401(k) retirement plan with a company match, plus an annual age/service-based Company contribution and an annual profit-sharing contribution, if applicable
* Complimentary 1:1 financial guidance with a licensed Fidelity representative


Time Off and Remote Work* Flexible work arrangements (part in-person/part remote)
* Unlimited paid time off for most roles plus time off for volunteering, jury duty, voting, and bereavement
* Personal holidays for colleagues to use in recognition of religious, cultural, or civic days
* Paid parental leave and paid family and medical leave policies


Emotional Well-being and Work-Life* Emotional well-being, mental health, and work/life resources powered by Spring Health
* Wellness programs, including fitness program and equipment reimbursement
* Child, adult, and elder back-up care support through Bright Horizons
* Adoption assistance

* Commuter benefits in select metropolitan areas


Equity & Inclusion

A culture that encourages colleagues to bring their authentic selves to work* Voluntary self-ID
* Pronunciation and phonetic spelling of names

*Benefits apply to full-time eligible employees. Interns are not eligible for most Company benefits.*  

Equal Employment Opportunity
Guardian is an equal opportunity employer. title: Head of Wealth Management and Field Technology
description:
As the lead of Wealth Management Technology & Digital Platforms for the Individual Markets (IM) Profit Center, your main responsibility is to drive innovation in product review, planning, creation, and maintenance support for advisor technologies across our Protection & Wealth segments. Individual Markets provides protection products like Life & Disability Insurance as well as Investment products through our Retail Broker Dealer & Registered Investment Advisor (RIA) to the affluent, high net worth clients in the US. We’re looking for exceptional candidates who think digitally and differently, resolve problems in non-traditional ways and strive to provide a remarkable experience for our advisors & producers that sell our services/products. This role will focus on providing our advisors & producers with a digital solution that is integrated across all our product lines for IM.
The ideal candidate has experience creating a comprehensive advisor workstation that pulls together multiple data sources, industry tools and systems to create an integrated & aggregated competitive technology platform to recruit & retain seasoned advisors. The candidate needs to have deep wealth management experience with multi custodian clearing firms (i.e., Pershing, National Financial), advisory (i.e., Envestnet, Orion) and turnkey asset management platforms (TAMP). The ideal candidate will be a seasoned technology professional and be a transformational leader in engineering/technology who will drive priorities while balancing risks, capital allocations, and change complexities throughout Individual Markets. The candidate must be able to solve complex problems, work through roadblocks and be able to see the big picture and how the pieces and parts fit together. Big delivery experience as well as technical and functional understanding in wealth & protection environments with a willingness to ‘roll-up sleeves’ are a must. Being able to partner with the business and create effective solutions for critical initiatives with innovation and forward compatibility is essential. This role reports to the Individual Markets CIO.
You Are:* A seasoned technology professional with experience in wealth management and financial industries
* A transformational leader with extensive experience in engineering/technology, capable of balancing risks, capital allocations, and change complexities
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work through roadblocks
* Big delivery experience and technical and functional expertise in a Financial Services environment
* Ability to partner with the business and create effective solutions for critical initiatives
* Comfortable with ambiguity and passionate about developing people and teams


You Will:* Develop and implement a unified technology strategy for our advisors & producers across all product lines for Individual Markets
* Bring industry experience to make build vs buy decisions on table stake technologies from pre-sales, client onboarding & servicing to financial planning, portfolio management and aggregated wealth & protection reporting
* Drive transformation from design to implementation, ensuring alignment with Guardian's technology strategy
* Demonstrate a high sense of urgency to influence changes and drive business outcomes from conception to delivery
* Champion a culture of best-in-class standards, pushes for progress, embraces change and challenges the status quo based on integrity, strong partnership and financial responsibility. Possess steadfast ethics and unwavering integrity
* Be a seasoned change leader through uncertainty and transformation. Engages team and partners throughout the journey including through ambiguity
* Manage multimillion-dollar vendor relationships and foster a culture of excellence and teamwork with vendors
* Continually assess systems for future growth and replacement to support business needs. Create business cases for furthering these efforts
* Ensure all governance models and being met so that systems are in accordance with the overall Guardian or Enterprise IT Strategy
* Foster a culture of teamwork, collaboration and integration across subject areas that drives excellent service, quality, diversity of thought, an engaging work environment and overall performance improvement


You Have:* 15+ years of experience in Wealth Management & Financial industries
* 10+ years of experience with agile development methodologies on programs with multiple teams and technologies
* Demonstrated experience with multi custodian clearing firms (Pershing, National Financial Services, Charles Schwab, etc.), advisory platforms (Envestnet, Orion, etc.), planning tools and CRMs
* Demonstrated experience managing geographically a diverse group of employees/colleagues and consultants
* Ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to varying audiences, including non-technical business executives
* Knowledge of modern Infrastructure and Application Development practices and tools
* Knowledge of Cloud-Enabled/Optimized practices and implications for Application Development
* Proven leadership, negotiation, and relationship management skills
* Bachelor's degree in a technical field and/or equivalent work experience
* Protection/Insurance exposure preferred
* Proven business focused IT executive with a strong understanding of how technology can drive business growth
* Extensive leadership experience demonstrated through empowerment, situational awareness, increasing transparency and conflict resolution on a large-scale program
* Hands-on, able and willing to work with teams while coaching them to reach efficient and effective performance levels
* Deep experience building digital solutions for advisors/sales teams in the Wealth Management industry. Prior exposure to insurance industry a nice to have
* A proven track record for motivating change in how organizations embrace agile and innovation


Location & Travel:* The position will need to be based in either: Holmdel, NJ, New York, NY (Hudson Yards), Boston, MA, Stamford. CT, or Bethlehem, PA
* The position will be hybrid with 3+ days in the office
* Will require travel as needed


Salary Range:
$225,000 - $280,000
The salary range reflected above is a good faith estimate of base pay for the primary location of the position. The salary for this position ultimately will be determined based on the education, experience, knowledge, and abilities of the successful candidate. title: Head of Workplace and Collaboration Technologies
description:
As the Head of Workplace and Collaboration Technologies at Guardian, you will lead the strategy and implementation of workplace technology services, enhancing collaboration and productivity across U.S. and India locations.
You Are:* A self-starter who is fueled by collaboration, likes working with people, and who thrives in partnering across the company with technology and business areas to ensuring that Workplace services are efficiently delivered to customers
* Someone with a solid understanding of Workplace Technology, including Windows Operating Systems, O365 and the entire Microsoft Email and Collaboration suite, End-point Security, Patch Management and Software Delivery
* Diligent, organized, and determined to successfully implement solutions
* Focused on continuous improvement to create a best-in-class Workplace Technology organization


You Will:* Collaborate with the Head of Enterprise Technology to establish objectives and standard operating procedures
* Lead and enhance employee experiences with reliable and efficient technology solutions
* Find opportunities and develop justifications for spending and initiatives, including identification of risks and cost/benefit analyses
* Enhance the Workplace Technology metrics to show actionable opportunities for improving the employee experience and meeting SLAs
* Coordinate internal and external audit activities for Workplace Technologies with external vendors and internal teams
* Manage Infrastructure and digital workplace team(s) to acquire resources, and align and coordinate priorities, work plans, and activities
* Define, develop, and expand the Service Desk, based on best-practice processes, disciplines, and related toolsets
* Provide direction on emerging technologies, communication and collaboration products and services within Workplace Technology
* Provide leadership, guidance, and supervision to Workplace Technology and Collaboration organization to provide superior results
* Ensure IT security policies are strictly effective to mitigate risks


You Have:* 10+ years’ of experience as a senior leader in Workplace Technology or similar role
* Familiar with Microsoft products - Windows OS, O365, SCCM, SharePoint, Defender, etc.
* Experience with Windows and MAC based laptops
* Understanding of endpoint tools such as JAMF or equivalent
* Working knowledge with monitoring tools such as Nexthink or equivalent
* Excellent leadership and customer management skills
* Demonstrated experience in working with globally distributed resources
* Understanding of network & endpoint security principals
* Solid understanding of automation and standard methodologies
* Must be self-motivated
* Ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly to peers and management
* Strong problem-solving abilities
* Ability to manage and lead large teams
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Business Administration, Information Technology or relevant field
* Excellent oral and verbal communication skills
* Detail oriented for accuracy of data and information
* Able to produce reports and complete work within deadlines
* Able to work well with interdepartmental teams and initiatives

title: Head of IT Service Management
description:
As the Head of IT Service Management at Guardian Life, you will drive our world-class technology service delivery. This is a unique opportunity to lead a team of multi-disciplinary service delivery managers, ensuring exceptional service performance and strategic alignment across the enterprise. If you are a proven leader with a passion for flawless operations and ambitious goals, we want you on our team.
You Are:* A self-starter fueled by collaboration, thriving in a fast-paced Fortune 500 environment.
* Exceptionally diligent and organized, with a solid understanding of technology operations.
* A leader of leaders, with demonstrable experience in incident, problem, change, and technology asset lifecycle management.
* Determined to successfully implement strategies and overcome obstacles.


You Will:* Lead the delivery of technology services and service delivery managers to ensure they meet the needs of the organization.
* Develop the strategy for Technology Asset Management across the Enterprise. This would include managing the accuracy and integrity the CMDB (Configuration Management Database) for all technology assets
* Oversee the communication between technology and other departments to ensure seamless delivery of services.
* Develop and implement service level agreements (SLAs) to ensure technology services are delivered efficiently and effectively.
* Work with technology service providers to ensure service levels are met and problems are resolved quickly.
* Provide the strategic direction for the quality of technology services provided and manage the resolution of any issues that arise.
* Develop and manage budgets for technology service delivery, and ensure resources are allocated effectively.
* Constantly monitor and report on service delivery performance to identify areas for improvement.
* Oversee the development and implementation of policies and procedures to ensure consistent and streamlined technology service delivery.
* Encourage the adoption of emerging technologies to continually improve technology service delivery.
* Provide leadership, guidance, and supervision to technology service delivery staff.


You Have:* 10+ years of experience as a Head of IT Service Management or similar role and leading a team of service delivery managers
* Solid understanding of service delivery processes and procedures
* Experience with Service-Now platform (ITAM and ITAM experience a plus)
* Excellent leadership and customer management skills
* Strong problem-solving abilities
* Ability to manage and lead teams
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Business Administration, Information Technology or relevant field
* Excellent oral and verbal communication skills.
* Detail oriented for accuracy of data and information.
* Able to produce reports and complete work within deadlines.
* Able to work well with interdepartmental teams and initiatives.

title: Dishwasher
description:
**Resumen del trabajo:**

**Buscamos un lavavajillas confiable y orientado a los detalles para unirse a nuestro equipo.**  Deberes: - Limpiar y desinfectar todos los platos, utensilios y equipos de manera oportuna y eficiente. - Mantener un área de lavado de platos limpia y organizada, incluida la lavadora de platos, el fregadero y las áreas de almacenamiento circundantes. - Asegúrese de que todo el equipo de servicio de alimentos y bebidas se limpie y desinfecte adecuadamente después de su uso. - Ayudar con el transporte de mesas y reponer suministros según sea necesario. - Trabajar eficazmente en un entorno acelerado, cumpliendo plazos y manteniendo una actitud positiva. - Colaborar con otro personal de cocina para garantizar un servicio perfecto durante las horas pico. - Participar en eventos de catering y banquetes, según sea necesario. - Mantener un área de cocina limpia y organizada, incluido el piso, los mostradores y las áreas de almacenamiento. - Seguir todas las pautas y protocolos de seguridad alimentaria. - Limpiar y mantener la cocina del hotel, incluyendo todos los equipos y electrodomésticos.

**Job Summary:**

**We are seeking a reliable and detail-oriented Dishwasher to join our team.**

Duties:

- Clean and sanitize all dishes, utensils, and equipment in a timely and efficient manner.  
- Maintain a clean and organized dishwashing area, including the dishwashing machine, sink, and surrounding storage areas.  
- Ensure that all food and beverage service equipment is properly cleaned and sanitized after use.  
- Assist with bussing tables and replenishing supplies as needed.  
- Work effectively in a fast-paced environment, meeting deadlines and maintaining a positive attitude.  
- Collaborate with other kitchen staff to ensure seamless service during peak hours.  
- Participate in catering and banquet events, as needed.  
- Maintain a clean and organized kitchen area, including the floor, counters, and storage areas.  
- Follow all food safety guidelines and protocols.  
- Clean and maintain the hotel's kitchen, including all equipment and appliances.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: From $15.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 per week

Ability to Commute:

* Old Greenwich, CT 06870 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Old Greenwich, CT 06870: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Head of Events
description:
**Who we are:**



For over 20 years, Global Relay has set the standard in enterprise information archiving with industry-leading cloud archiving, surveillance, eDiscovery, and analytics solutions. We securely capture and preserve the communications data of the world's most highly regulated firms, giving them greater visibility and control over their information and ensuring compliance with stringent regulations.



Though we offer competitive compensation and benefits and all the other perks one would expect from an established company, we are not your typical technology company. Global Relay is a career-building company. A place for big ideas. New challenges. Groundbreaking innovation. It's a place where you can genuinely make an impact – and be recognized for it.



We believe great businesses thrive on diversity, inclusion, and the contributions of all employees. To that end, we recruit candidates from different backgrounds and foster a work environment that encourages employees to collaborate and learn from each other, completely free of barriers.



We encourage you to apply if your qualifications and experience are a good fit for any of our openings.

**Your role:**  

As Head of Events at Global Relay, you are responsible for the successful project delivery of events across all our key accounts, managing and leading the global events team to build relationships and drive revenue. This is a hands-on, multifaceted role with room to grow - from creating new concept events, to managing large scale budgets.



Working proactively and thinking outside of the box, you are responsible for the growth of our compliance community and thought leadership network, ensuring the delivery of great speakers and valued events.



Sitting within the marketing team, you work closely with departments across the business to always ensure customer satisfaction and smooth project delivery.



We have a new office launching in New York in a prestigious location, with events facilities to match. Alongside our London office, the New York office will be our flagship location for events – offering a vibrant events scene for both customers and prospects. With global oversight, you are responsible for the consistent, successful delivery of events across both offices.



As well as delivering events, you will work across the business to create an events calendar to support internal and external events – from in-house roundtables, to ensuring we have significant presence at the most promising external industry conferences.  

  

**Your job:**


* 360 management of in-person events, with a focus on operations
* Commercial oversight and event strategy
* Managing event schedules, timelines, and deadlines
* Supplier sourcing and management
* Large scale budget management
* Managing event collaboration with marketing teams
* Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and adhering to deadlines
* Working well within a close-knit team
* Onsite event delivery
* Post event reporting


**About you:**


* Excellent line management experience of teams of 4+
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
* Previous experience in B2B events
* Capable of creating detailed proposals and creative client pitching
* Experience with RFP's
* In-depth knowledge of AV and production
* Highly skilled in event operations, implementation, and execution of processes
* Solid understanding of global venues, alongside excellent research skills
* Confident in managing large scale budgets in multiple currencies
* Able to support forecasting and revenue projections
* Ensures consistency of company standards internally and externally enhancing the brand
* Demonstrates outstanding time management, problem-solving and organizational skills
* Ability to anticipate needs, prioritize and meet tight deadlines
* Willing to take initiative and maintain a 'can-do' and flexible attitude
* Possesses a creative and organized mindset
* Consistently delivers a premium customer experience with an 'above and beyond' attitude
* Proven experience with IT programs such as Microsoft Word, Excel, Salesforce, and PowerPoint

**What you can expect:**



At Global Relay, there's no ceiling to what you can achieve. It's the land of opportunity for the energetic, the intelligent, the driven. You'll receive the mentoring, coaching, and support you need to reach your career goals. You'll be part of a culture that breeds creativity and rewards perseverance and hard work. And you'll be working alongside smart, talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with complementary knowledge and skills.



Global Relay is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.



We seek to ensure reasonable adjustments, accommodations, and personal time are tailored to meet the unique needs of every individual.



We understand flexible work arrangements are important, and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it's flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.



To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

title: Product Design Lead
description:
**What You'll Be a Part Of:**



ActionIQ is a new kind of customer data platform that lets marketing teams tap directly into central data sources and activate it anywhere in the customer journey. Unlike traditional CDPs, ActionIQ keeps data securely where it lives and makes it easy for marketers to design personalized interactions that unlock revenue across the entire customer lifecycle. We are backed by top-tier VCs Andreessen Horowitz, Sequoia Capital, and March Capital. We partner with enterprise brands such as Albertsons, e.l.f., Dell, The Washington Post and many more to achieve growth through extraordinary customer experiences.


**The Team You'll Join:**



We're seeking a Product Design Lead to spearhead design thinking and maintain our design systems library. As a senior member, you'll report into our VP, Design and leverage your expertise in visual and experience design to solve complex problems and create innovative products. You'll shape the AIQ product vision, playing a pivotal role in scaling and innovating our core offering.


**One year from now you will have:**


* Extensive understanding of what our platform does and how it works
* Claimed ownership in responsibilities of product designer
* Maintained our design systems and UI pattern library and have built a partnership with Engineering in building out the StoryBook
* Collaborated with colleagues in design, product, engineering, and professional services, to expand our customer data platform to support our clients' digital marketing strategies
* Contributed to the ongoing rollout of new features and pages in the product roadmap
* Helped to define new processes for product and user experience design as we scale and grow


**How You'll Contribute:**


* Maintain design systems and UI pattern library for the product design team and work closely with Front End to align the StoryBook UI components
* Employ Design Thinking process while collaborating with cross-functional teams (product managers, engineers, data science, professional services) for optimal deployment
* Partner with the Technical Writer to streamline UX copy and content, ensuring user comprehension is effortless
* Gather stakeholders and facilitate whiteboard sessions to sketch user flows and wireframes
* Put together clickable prototypes to guide non-designers of the user experience
* Deliver and present a comprehensive, detailed spec walkthrough to Engineers
* Plan, recruit, and conduct user research
* Apply quantitative and qualitative data to driver user research or optimize for intuitive user experience

  

  

**What You Bring**:


* Expert knowledge in Figma
* Familiarity in Storybook and Chromatic or similar tools
* Understanding of all stages of design thinking such as discovery, define, design, and delivery
* Highly collaborative with a curious mindset to constantly seek feedback and perspective from others when working with cross functional teams
* Ability to multitask in various scale of projects from simple UI feature reiteration, to designing of a data-heavy dashboard pages
* Possess a strong understanding of data driven, marketing, or SaaS platforms
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to listen, articulate, and advocate designs


**Background:**


* University Degree in Design, HCI, Interaction or similar area, or a portfolio to demonstrate the equivalent experience
* 5+ years of product design experience
* Experience in B2B platform/software company is a must


Note: You must have an online portfolio demonstrating your work experience


**Compensation:**


* Our compensation package includes base salary, stock options, and the great benefits shown below.
	+ The salary range for this role is: $145,000 - $165,000

**Benefits & Perks Preview:**


* **Stay Happy and Healthy:** Enjoy leading Medical, Dental and Vision benefits, 401k, FSA, Commuter Benefits, Gym Reimbursement, flexible PTO and 12-weeks paid parental leave
* **Accelerate Your Career:** Opportunities to explore, enhance, and expand your skill set through conferences, workshops, and access to Udemy learning courses.
* **Enjoy the View:** We have a beautiful office in NYC right on Madison Square Park, and local employees come into the office on a hybrid schedule, three days a week (M, W, Th) #LI-Hybrid. Office perks include catered lunches, a stocked kitchen with beverages and snacks, and monthly social hours.

title: Investment Banking Analyst
description:
*CastleOak Securities, L.P. ("CastleOak") is a premier boutique investment bank focused on providing capital markets services to a broad array of corporate, governmental and institutional clients. Headquartered in New York City, the firm specializes in primary and secondary sales and trading of fixed income, equity, and money market securities, as well as financial advisory (including M&A and private placements). Since its founding in 2006, CastleOak has assisted its clients on public offerings totaling over $4 trillion. CastleOak's professionals average 20 years of successful Wall Street experience and ongoing working relationships with some of the largest global corporations.*


*We offer a competitive total rewards package including:*

  

* *Hybrid workplace: work from home 2 days per week!*
* *Health insurance: competitive medical, dental, and vision programs*
* *Commuter benefits*
* *401(k) with a company match*
* *Charitable contribution match program for employees*
* *Company-paid life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance*
* *Paid time off: vacation, personal days, sick leave, etc.*
* *Intentional culture celebrations and social outings*
  

The Investment Banking Analyst will be a critical part of the CastleOak team responsible for supporting Capital Markets and Investment Banking activities. The Analyst will add value to the Corporate Capital Markets Origination and Syndicate team which is responsible for delivering our clients debt and equity capital markets, liability management, share repurchase and cash management solutions. The Analyst will also interact extensively with Syndicate, Advisory, Sales & Trading, Rates, Money Funds and Equity Trading, which help deliver financing, capital raising, and risk management solutions to clients. The Analyst will work with experienced officers and associates to perform a variety of assignments and tasks, depending on business need.



Analysts are crucial in executing client assignments, ensuring deliverables are timely, meet high-quality standards, and are crafted with meticulous attention to detail. Their work primarily involves analytical projects and tasks that support Senior Investment Bankers and clients. Through this role, Analysts gain experience across various sectors by analyzing client financials, capital market transactions, and market trends. Additionally, they are responsible for preparing requests for proposals, creating client presentations, and conducting research related to both current and potential clients.



Analysts will be exposed to all aspects of a transaction, including sourcing and pitching Capital Markets and Investment Banking capabilities, assisting Syndicate and engaging with Sales & Trading on executing Capital Markets transactions, and delivering a final recommendation, valuation or feedback to a client post-transaction.

  


**Two Year Analyst Program:**



CastleOak's two-year analyst program provides industry exposure, training and networking opportunities. The firm's smaller employee size puts analysts on the front lines, offering direct involvement in deals, while our flat organization offers access to leaders who have extensive knowledge and relationships. Analysts engage in ongoing training designed to build both skills and industry knowledge. With opportunities for social engagement built in, CastleOak's analyst program offers a comprehensive experience to help you define the next step in your career.



Additionally, analysts will be paired with a mentor that provides support and guidance on topics like professional development, core skills, potential areas of specialization and networking. Social components of the program support relationship-building and broader industry exposure. The training component of the program will include a mixture of formal and informal training. Together, these core program components equip analysts to thrive in the industry.

  


**Essential Responsibilities:**


* Prepare weekly reports and assist Capital Markets with market updates
* Manage deal documentation and execution for Debt, Equity and Securitization underwritings
* Conduct company/sector research for Investment Banking, along with market analysis and research. Prepare pitchbooks, provide marketing support and attend client meetings.
* Assist in issuer due diligence.
* Develop industry specific knowledge of the client base and awareness of key decision makers (i.e. CFOs, Treasurers, Capital Markets Directors)
* Analyze and utilize financial data to build financial models, prepare valuation material, and client presentations.

  


**Required Qualifications:**

* Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
* Quantitative analysis and advanced writing skills
* Strong desire to learn and exceptional critical thinking skills
* Understanding of fundamental financial concepts
* Track record of outstanding achievement in academics, employment and personal endeavors
* Applicants should have superior interpersonal and organizational skills and the ability to thrive in an entrepreneurial environment.
* Creativity, problem solving skills, flexibility in approach and the ability to work with members of multiple product groups at the same time. Ability to analyze complex client financial objectives

  


**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Previous investment banking experience is preferred and analyst training experience is a plus
* Securities Industry Essentials (SIE) exam, Series 79 and 63 licenses, or obtain within 3 months
* Proficiency in using Bloomberg and S&P Capital IQ
* Mastery of Excel and VBA programing knowledge

  


**Salary Expectations:**


* Base salary is expected to be $75,000-80,000, commensurate with experience; eligible for discretionary bonus

  



Location: New York, NY



Travel: 10‐20%

  

*All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, marital status, medical condition (including pregnancy and related conditions), physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, and/or any other characteristic protected by law.*
